overview_of_class: This course seeks to provide a thorough understanding of the central ideas of the three "classical' social thinkers whose work has been foundational for sociological analysis: Emile Durkheim (1858-1917), Karl Marx (1818-1883), and Max Weber (1864-1920). Class sessions will explore each thinker's major concepts, the larger arguments that he builds from those concepts, and the distinctive manner in which he proposes to analyze the social world.
name: Sociological Theory
subject: SOCIOL
